An iconic FPS with unmatched strategic depth, plagued to death by a failing matchmaking system and a rampant cheating problem.

I have refrained from writing a negative review for years, fearing I'd be yet another salty individual complaining about the thousands of hours spent playing a game. However one cannot remain silent about the current reality of CSGO, when seen against the backdrop of the rivers of money flowing towards Valve.

The matchmaking in this game is a complete joke and does not work properly, which is incredible in this day and age of online gaming. Whether in solo queue or as a premade lobby, the algorithm will go out of its way to match me and my friends against either aim gods with twice or thrice our playtime (so anywhere between 4K and 6K hours, which, coming from someone with more than 2,700 hours, is starting to look like a full-time job), or complete noobs who apparently just bought the game. We are either hopelessly outmatched, or tearing the opponents to pieces: ranks right now are just meaningless make-believe.

Then there is the cheating problem. Apparently, there are no cheaters in CSGO, since the top devs, unusually talkative when it comes to self-promotion, are content with their internal stats. This fa√ßade only hides a bitter reality: the cheaters are everywhere, and since the game went F2P, they grew bolder and bolder to the point that most do not hide their hacks anymore. My history shows hundreds of banned players, each ruining countless matches. I have kept a tab on the most blatant cheaters and seen them carry on playing for hundreds of games before being banned, only to make or buy a new account the very same day and bragging about it. Valve simply does not care. Their AI supposedly smart enough to convict cheaters is dumb as a brick and does not work: the cheaters have won, and it's not even like they're one step ahead. They just profit off of Valve's idleness.

If you're on the verge of investing time and energy in CSGO, please do yourself a favor and find some other game to play. Right now, there is nothing but bitterness and frustration to be found here.
